alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 2:55PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Cochise County through 345 PM MST... At 254 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near and west of Portal, or 11 miles west of Rodeo, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Portal, Chiricahua National Monument and Paradise. This includes the following highways... Route 181 between mile markers 52 and 64. Route 186 between mile markers 355 and 359. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox
